## Verify class

A class for deploying and calling methods on a Verify.

Trust-minimised contract to record the state of some verification process. When some off-chain identity is to be reified on chain there is inherently some multi-party, multi-faceted trust relationship. For example, the DID (Decentralized Identifiers) specification from W3C outlines that the controller and the subject of an identity are two different entities.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Verify extends FactoryContract 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [FactoryContract](./rain-sdk.factorycontract.md)

## Remarks

This class provides an easy way to deploy Verifies using Rain's canonical factories, and methods for interacting with an already deployed Verify.

## Example


```typescript
import { Verify } from 'rain-sdk'

// To deploy a new Verify, pass an ethers.js Signer, the chainId and the config for the Verify.
const newVerify = await Verify.deploy(signer, chainId, VerifyConfigArgs)

// To connect to an existing Verify just pass the address and an ethers.js Signer.
const existingVerify = new Verify(address, signer)

// Once you have a Verify, you can call the smart contract methods:
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [add](./rain-sdk.verify.add.md) |  | (data: BytesLike, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | An account adds their own verification evidence. Internally <code>msg.sender</code> is used; delegated <code>add</code> is not supported. |
|  [approve](./rain-sdk.verify.approve.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | An <code>APPROVER</code> can review added evidence and approve accounts. Typically many approvals would be submitted in a single call which is more convenient and gas efficient than sending individual transactions for every approval. However, as there are many individual agents acting concurrently and independently this requires that the approval process be infallible so that no individual approval can rollback the entire batch due to the actions of some other approver/banner. It is possible to approve an already approved or banned account. The <code>Approve</code> event will always emit but the approved block will only be set if it was previously uninitialized. A banned account will always be seen as banned when calling <code>statusAtBlock</code> regardless of the approval block, even if the approval is more recent than the ban. The only way to reset a ban is to remove and reapprove the account. |
|  [APPROVER\_ADMIN](./rain-sdk.verify.approver_admin.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Admin role for <code>APPROVER</code> |
|  [APPROVER](./rain-sdk.verify.approver.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Role for <code>APPROVER</code> |
|  [ban](./rain-sdk.verify.ban.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | A <code>BANNER</code> can ban an added OR approved account. |
|  [BANNER\_ADMIN](./rain-sdk.verify.banner_admin.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Admin role for <code>BANNER</code> |
|  [BANNER](./rain-sdk.verify.banner.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Role for <code>BANNER</code> |

|  [DEFAULT\_ADMIN\_ROLE](./rain-sdk.verify.default_admin_role.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | By default, the admin role for all roles is <code>DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE</code>, which means that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other roles.<!-- -->WARNING: The <code>DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE</code> is also its own admin: it has permission to grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure accounts that have been granted it. |

|  [grantRole](./rain-sdk.verify.grantrole.md) |  | (role: BytesLike, account: string, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Grants <code>role</code> to <code>account</code>.<!-- -->If <code>account</code> had not been already granted <code>role</code>, emits a RoleGranted event.<!-- -->Require that caller have admin role of <code>role</code>. |

|  [isChild](./rain-sdk.verify.ischild.md) | <code>static</code> | (signer: Signer, maybeChild: string) =&gt; Promise&lt;boolean&gt; | Checks if address is registered as a child contract of this VerifyFactory on a specific network |
|  [nameBookReference](./rain-sdk.verify.namebookreference.md) | <code>static</code> | (not declared) |  |
|  [remove](./rain-sdk.verify.remove.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | A <code>REMOVER</code> can scrub state mapping from an account. A malicious account MUST be banned rather than removed. Removal is useful to reset the whole process in case of some mistake. |
|  [REMOVER\_ADMIN](./rain-sdk.verify.remover_admin.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Admin role for <code>REMOVER</code> |

|  [renounceRole](./rain-sdk.verify.renouncerole.md) |  | (role: BytesLike, account: string, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Revokes <code>role</code> from the calling account.<!-- -->Roles are often managed via grantRole and revokeRole: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).<!-- -->If the calling account had been granted <code>role</code>, emits a RoleRevoked event.<!-- -->Requires the caller to be the <code>account</code>. |
|  [requestApprove](./rain-sdk.verify.requestapprove.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Any approved address can request some other address be approved. Frivolous requestors SHOULD expect to find themselves banned. |
|  [requestBan](./rain-sdk.verify.requestban.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Any approved address can request some other address be banned. Frivolous requestors SHOULD expect to find themselves banned. |
|  [requestRemove](./rain-sdk.verify.requestremove.md) |  | (evidences: [Evidence](./rain-sdk.evidence.md)<!-- -->\[\], overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Any approved address can request some other address be removed. Frivolous requestors SHOULD expect to find themselves banned. |
|  [revokeRole](./rain-sdk.verify.revokerole.md) |  | (role: BytesLike, account: string, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Revokes <code>role</code> from <code>account</code>.<!-- -->If <code>account</code> had been granted <code>role</code>, emits a RoleRevoked event.<!-- -->Require that caller have admin role of <code>role</code>. |

|  [supportsInterface](./rain-sdk.verify.supportsinterface.md) |  | (interfaceId: BytesLike, overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;boolean&gt; | Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by <code>interfaceId</code>. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165\#how-interfaces-are-identified\[EIP section\] to learn more about how these ids are created. |
